articles.author: Andrew Mills, Nidal Al-Mughrabi
articles.description: Negotiators were to meet in the Qatari capital Doha again on Friday in an effort to hammer out a Gaza ceasefire agreement as Israel continued to slam targets in the Palestinian enclave.
articles.title: Gaza ceasefire negotiations extend another day as death toll exceeds 40,000

articles.author: Guy Faulconbridge, Olzhas Auyezov
articles.description: An influential aide to Russian President Vladimir Putin said on Friday that the West and the U.S.-led NATO alliance had helped to plan Ukraine's surprise attack on Russia's Kursk region, something Washington has denied.
articles.title: Kremlin accuses the West of helping Ukraine attack Russia

articles.author: Nandita Bose
articles.description: Kamala Harris outlined proposals to cut taxes for most Americans, ban "price gouging" by grocers and boost affordable housing on Friday in her first major economy-focused speech as the Democratic presidential nominee.
articles.title: Harris pledges to tackle costs and taxes in economy-focused address

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Indian medical professionals started a 24-hour shutdown of non-emergency services across the country on Saturday in protest against the brutal rape and murder of a doctor in the eastern city of Kolkata.
articles.title: Indian doctors begin 24-hour strike to protest brutal rape of medic

articles.author: Jasmine Patterson, Nicola Muirhead
articles.description: Hurricane Ernesto was weakening as it closed in on Bermuda early on Saturday, downgraded to a Category 1 storm but still threatening the British island territory with powerful winds, a dangerous storm surge and potentially deadly flooding.
articles.title: Hurricane Ernesto weakens, but still dangerous, as it closes in on Bermuda

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: A pilot died on Friday after the Fouga Magister jet which he was flying during an airshow in Lavandou, southern France, crashed into the Mediterranean sea, said French authorities.
articles.title: Pilot dies after his plane crashes into sea during French airshow

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Argentina's Federal Police dismantled what it said was a terrorist cell planning attacks on the Jewish community in the city of Mendoza, the National Security Ministry said in a statement on Friday, describing the group as an "Islamist terrorist organization."
articles.title: Argentine police thwart alleged terror attacks in Mendoza

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: At least six Burkina Faso magistrates have been conscripted to serve in the military this month for taking action against pro-junta activists and other individuals, three unions of magistrates said in a joint statement.
articles.title: Burkina Faso conscripts magistrates for acting against junta, unions say

articles.author: Bhanvi Satija, Jennifer Rigby
articles.description: The European Centre for Disease Prevention and Control (ECDC) on Friday raised its risk level for mpox, a day after global health officials confirmed the first infection with a new strain of the virus outside Africa, in Sweden.
articles.title: EU public health body raises mpox risk alert level

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Outgoing Japanese Prime Minister Fumio Kishida is finalising plans to visit the United States in late September for the U.N. General Assembly and a possible meeting with President Joe Biden, the Yomiuri newspaper reported on Saturday.
articles.title: Japan PM Kishida plans US visit in late September, Yomiuri reports
